videos.description: When Pia Ranada was present during the press briefings, there always seemed to be a dark cloud that filled the room. For the first time, I see a lighter mood in the press room. Roque's style, although hard-hitting is filled with wit which has endeared him to the press. He is so unlike a "SPOX" wannabee who advocated a confrontational approach with the media. Personally, I wouldn't mind being the SPOX's apprentice or even a student because there is so much to learn from him. Sorry to say this, but SPOX's is shining while his main critic is made irrelevant and ignored by the President.
videos.title: Malacañang Press Corps press briefing  is fun without Pia Ranada

videos.description:
PANOORIN | Rappler's Pia Ranada: The Newshen Who Has Balls 

By Al Rosero, Correspondent

Rappler's ace reporter Pia Ranada will surely land in the history of journalism in the country a good niche for standing firm, calm and professional, unshrinking and unpanicky before an enraged President Duterte spewing thunderous, scathing expletives against Rappler.

In a video obviously taken by a government camera whose footage was first shared to a DDS troll sites, Duterte was surrounded by more than a dozen of PSG bodyguards and staffers. He spewed out high-pitched verbal tirades against Rappler about its foreign ownership issue, that resulted to the cancellation of its license by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

But Pia maintained her poise and grace as an articulate and assertive reporter under so intense pressure no less than made by the country's most powerful man, who is earning a lot of despotic descriptions in his attempts to suppress Rappler, which has been equated by media organizations and foreign press as press freedom.

But instead of caving in, Pia confronted Duterte, rolled the video camera of her cellphone even as she was throwing follow up questions and motioning resistance and opposition to the scoldings and reasonings of Duterte.

Pia seems to be alone as other reporters distanced from her position while the burly persons surrounding the PDuterte stood in standstill listening, casting a collective machismo on guard, whose sight is enough for any faint-hearted woman to fall to her knees. 

If there is apt description that can be given to Pia Ranada for her class act in a so hellish situation right inside Malacanang Palace, it is that she is a brave newshen who has balls to assert and find truth, to be true and loyal to her craft.

--
video credit: downloaded from RTVMalacanang with our edited text caption. Pls. Like our Page to get news updates from Mindanao. - Ed. Cha Monforte
videos.title: | Rappler's Pia Ranada: The Newshen Who Has Balls

Media bias is the bias of journalists and news producers within the mass media in the selection of many events and stories that are reported and how they are covered. The term "media bias" implies a pervasive or widespread bias contravening the standards of journalism, rather than the perspective of an individual journalist or article. The direction and degree of media bias in various countries is widely disputed.[1]

Practical limitations to media neutrality include the inability of journalists to report all available stories and facts, and the requirement that selected facts be linked into a coherent narrative.[2] Government influence, including overt and covert censorship, biases the media in some countries, for example China, North Korea and Myanmar.[3][4] Market forces that result in a biased presentation include the ownership of the news source, concentration of media ownership, the subjective selection of staff, or the preferences of an intended audience.

There are a number of national and international watchdog groups that report on bias of the media

videos.description:
PIA RANADA NG RAPPLER: KULANG ANG MGA SINSABI NG PANGULO!

Ayon kay Pia Ranada ng rappler at Cito Beltran ng Phil. Star  kulang daw ang mga sinsabi ng pangulo sa tuwing haharapin nito ang publiko via live stream.

Hindi daw ito detalyado at puro warning lang ang laman.

Ito ay sinagot ni Sec. Panelo! 

Panoorin natin kung paano ito sinagot isa isa ni Sec. Panelo
videos.title: PIA RANADA NG RAPPLER : KULANG ANG MGA SINSABI NG PANGULO!

This issue is very simple. Philippine Constitution embodies the interest of the Philippine Nation. When you allow foreign people to own a media corp in the country, there is a big chance that it can threathen the peace, security, and national activities of the country. Media trust is a powerful tool. When it is used incorrectly, it can tear down a Nation. Thus, the Philippine Constitution is made in such a way that will benefit the country itself securing the sustainability of its identity as an independent Nation. Thus, this constitution cannot allow foreign investors to influence, and/or own a media company inside this country.

I ask this question to these media people.

Are you really Filipinos?

You keep criticizing the government in the issue of press freedom oppression though the issue here is about foreign ownership of media in the country. Law is the law. That's a fact. If you are a citizen of this country. You must abide. Criticize the wrong doings of the government if there is and if you see fit (to exercise your right) but be sure that you are not violating any laws of this country.

To the government, please do investigation of other media companies' credibility based on the same law that Rappler was given a trial with. Baka kasi may mga nakakalusot pala na iba. Baka kasi sabihin nila eh bias.

videos.title: Press Freedom Part 3 | Pia Ranada

videos.description:
#NEVERFORGET: CORY AQUINO'S DIRECT ATTACK ON PRESS FREEDOM

The Securities and Exchange Commission recently revoked Rappler's corporate registration after the latter violated the constitutional prohibition on foreign ownership and management of mass media, among other laws. 

All Liberal Party officials and their bleeding heart supporters immediately decried what they believe to be an attack on Freedom of the Press, despite the fact that Rappler indeed ceded control of its operations to foreigners, something that's expressly forbidden by Philippine Law.

I think these bleeding hearts need to look not too far back in history, when a president -- that they so admire -- DIRECTLY attacked Press Freedom herself.

AQUINO VS BELTRAN

In 1987, Philippine Star columnist Luis Beltran wrote that President Corazon "Cory" Aquino hid under her bed during a coup d'etat. Incensed, Aquino sued Beltran and the Star for Libel, and Aquino even went as far as showing journalists that she couldn't fit under her bed. 

Beltran, who openly criticized Aquino for her incompetence, said his words should not have been taken literally. Nevertheless, Beltran and the Star issued groveling apologies to the President Aquino for the supposed misunderstanding.

Aquino didn't accept Beltran and the Star's apology. She still pursued the case, with her even sitting on the witness stand WHILE SHE WAS STILL THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC, as shown in the accompanying video clip.

BELTRAN AND STAR CONVICTED

The court ruled in favor of Aquino in 1992, sentenced Beltran and Star Editor Max Soliven to 2 years in prison, and ordered them to pay Php 2 million in damages.

The Duterte Government's issue against Rappler is about foreign ownership, which directly affects National Security. Meanwhile, the Aquino Government's issue against the Star is about defamation, and issue that Star has apologized for, an issue that affected nothing but Aquino's fragile ego. 

The Duterte Government simply rescinded Rappler's corporate registration, which does not prevent Rappler from covering Malacanang. It is a mere administrative case that involved no jail sentences and no fines. Meanwhile, the Aquino Government -- through no less than Cory Aquino herself -- aggressively sent two journalists to jail.

Should Pres. Rody Duterte sue Rappler's Pia Ranada Robles just like how Pres. Corazon Aquino sued Philippine Star's Luis Beltran while she was still president?

Isipin mo ha, ang sinabi lang ni Beltran e nagtago si Cory sa ilalim kama. Meanwhile, ang sinabi ni Pia e nangungurakot si Christopher Bong Go and by virtue of his being your alter ego, e nangungurakot ka rin.

O di ba?

If there's a government that really directly attacked press freedom, it's the Government of Cory Aquino, the Government of the person that the Yellow Bleeding Hearts adore.

Never Forget.
videos.title: PRESIDENT CORY AQUINO SITS ON THE WITNESS STAND

videos.description:
[AIRING]

‘Warding oneself to divulge the struggles of today is securing a freedom to live with our own stories tomorrow’

Our sixth speaker is Pia Ranada, a Malacañang News Correspondent from Rappler and a recipient of the Carlos Palanca Award.

As we celebrate Madla't Midya, we coincide with the fight for press freedom that signifies our exercise of democracy. Despite threats to the press, the Political Science Club alongside its partner organizations continues to stand high ground for conscious and enlightened journalism. A bastion of genuine representation to the toiling masses resonates on championing their calls and addressing their grievances —  a pivotal impetus to broadcast the truth.

#BroadcastTheTruth
#MadlatMidya
#DefendPressFreedom

videos.description:
WATCH: Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea speaks up on issue of Palace’s decision to bar Pia Ranada of Rappler to cover Malacañang events

“There was already an SEC decision revoking their license, ang accreditation ni Pia is from that particular accreditation so nawala din ‘yung kanyang accreditation in effect.”

On question whether Rappler can still cover Palace events, Medialdea said, “I-cover muna nila... Ayusin muna nila ‘yung kanilang personality as a corporation, as a local corporation, otherwise they cannot. ‘Yun ang gist ng decision ng SEC eh.”

Medialdea stressed, President Rodrigo Duterte is only enforcing the SEC ruling. | via Sweeden Velado
videos.title: WATCH: Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea speaks up on issue of Palace’s decision to bar Pia Ranada of Rappler to cover Malacañang events

videos.description:
CURTAILMENT KAMO NG PRESS FREEDOM? ITO ANG CURTAILMENT OF PRESS FREEDOM

#NEVERFORGET: CORY AQUINO SUES PHILSTAR'S BELTRAN FOR LIBEL WHILE SHE'S STILL PRESIDENT

The Securities and Exchange Commission recently revoked Rappler's corporate registration after the latter violated the constitutional prohibition on foreign ownership and management of mass media, among other laws. 

All Liberal Party officials and their bleeding heart supporters immediately decried what they believe to be an attack on Freedom of the Press, despite the fact that Rappler indeed ceded control of its operations to foreigners, something that's expressly forbidden by Philippine Law.

I think these bleeding hearts need to look not too far back in history, when a president -- that they so admire -- DIRECTLY attacked Press Freedom herself.

AQUINO VS BELTRAN

In 1987, Philippine Star columnist Luis Beltran wrote that President Corazon "Cory" Aquino hid under her bed during a coup d'etat. Incensed, Aquino sued Beltran and the Star for Libel, and Aquino even went as far as showing journalists that she couldn't fit under her bed. 

Beltran, who openly criticized Aquino for her incompetence, said his words should not have been taken literally. Nevertheless, Beltran and the Star issued groveling apologies to the President Aquino for the supposed misunderstanding.

Aquino didn't accept Beltran and the Star's apology. She still pursued the case, with her even sitting on the witness stand WHILE SHE WAS STILL THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC, as shown in the accompanying video clip.

BELTRAN AND STAR CONVICTED

The court ruled in favor of Aquino in 1992, sentenced Beltran and Star Editor Max Soliven to 2 years in prison, and ordered them to pay Php 2 million in damages.

The Duterte Government's issue against Rappler is about foreign ownership, which directly affects National Security. Meanwhile, the Aquino Government's issue against the Star is about defamation, and issue that Star has apologized for, an issue that affected nothing but Aquino's fragile ego. 

The Duterte Government simply rescinded Rappler's corporate registration, which does not prevent Rappler from covering Malacanang. It is a mere administrative case that involved no jail sentences and no fines. Meanwhile, the Aquino Government -- through no less than Cory Aquino herself -- aggressively sent two journalists to jail.

Should Pres. Rody Duterte sue Rappler's Pia Ranada Robles just like how Pres. Corazon Aquino sued Philippine Star's Luis Beltran while she was still president?

Isipin mo ha, ang sinabi lang ni Beltran e nagtago si Cory sa ilalim kama. Meanwhile, ang sinabi ni Pia e nangungurakot si Christopher Bong Go and by virtue of his being your alter ego, e nangungurakot ka rin.

O di ba?

If there's a government that really directly attacked press freedom, it's the Government of Cory Aquino, the Government of the person that the Yellow Bleeding Hearts adore.

Never Forget.
